contenido.en:
Most religions teach that the soul is immortal and continues to live after death. However, the Bible teaches otherwise: the soul is not a separate, immortal entity. In fact, the soul can die, and it represents the whole person‚Äînot something that survives the body.

üîπ The soul can die
> ‚ÄúFear the one who can destroy both soul and body in Gehenna.‚Äù ‚Äî Matthew 10:28
> ‚ÄúThe soul who sins is the one who will die.‚Äù ‚Äî Ezekiel 18:4
The Bible clearly states that the soul is not indestructible.

üîπ The soul is the whole person
> ‚ÄúEvery soul that does not listen to that prophet will be destroyed.‚Äù ‚Äî Acts 3:23
> ‚ÄúThe man became a living soul.‚Äù ‚Äî Genesis 2:7
The soul is not something humans have‚Äîit‚Äôs what they are.

üîπ The dead are unconscious
> ‚ÄúThe living know they will die, but the dead know nothing at all.‚Äù ‚Äî Ecclesiastes 9:5
> ‚ÄúThat very day his thoughts perish.‚Äù ‚Äî Psalm 146:4
Scripture shows that the dead are not alive or conscious in another realm.

üîπ Biblical hope: the resurrection
If the soul were immortal, there would be no need for resurrection. But the Bible promises a future resurrection as the true hope for the dead (John 5:28-29).

üîπ False doctrines introduced later
Belief in the immortal soul originated in Greek philosophy‚Äîespecially from Plato‚Äîand was later adopted by religion after the second century. Ancient Jews did not hold this belief; they expected a resurrection.

‚úÖ Conclusion
The Bible teaches that the soul is not immortal. The soul dies with the body. The real hope for the dead is the resurrection promised by God through Jesus Christ.
